title: Based on GOOGL's 10-Qs, calculate the company's Q2-FY2025 FCF Conversion of Adjusted EBITDA. Define FCF as OCF - Capex. Adjust EBITDA by adding back SBC expense. Express your answer as a percentage, rounded to two decimal places.
description:
1. Identify Q2-FY2025 Income from operations: $31271 millions.
 
 2. Gather H2 and Q1 figures in USD millions and obtain Q2 figures by subtraction.
 
 H2 OFC = 63,897
 H2 Purchases of property and equipment = 39,643; 
 H2 Depreciation of property and equipment = 9,485
 H2 Stock-based compensation expense= 11,514
 
 Q1 OFC = 36,150
 Q1 Purchases of property and equipment = 17,197
 Q1 Depreciation of property and equipment = 4,487
 Q1 Stock-based compensation expense = 5,516
 
 3. Compute Q2 FY2025 figures:
 
 OCF Q2 = 63,897 − 36,150 = 27,747
 Capex Q2 = 39,643 − 17,197 = 22,446
 
 4. Calculate Q2 FY2025 Free Cash Flow 
 FCF Q2 = 27,747 − 22,446 = 5,301.
 
 5. Calculate Q2 FY2025 EBITDA:
 
 Depreciation of property and equipment (DPE) Q2 = 9,485 − 4,487 = 4,998
 EBITDA Q2 = Income from operations Q2 + DPE Q2 = 31,271 + 4,998 = 36,269
 
 6. Adjust EBITDA by adding back stock-based compensation (SBC): 
 
 SBC Q2 = 11,514 − 5,516 = 5,998
 Adjusted EBITDA Q2 = 36,269 + 5,998 = 42,267
 
 7. Compute Q2 FY2025 FCF Conversion of Adjusted EBITDA and round to two decimals: 
 FCF Conversion = FCF Q2 ÷ Adjusted EBITDA Q2 = 5,301 ÷ 42,267 = 12.54%.

rubric.criteria: Identify Income from operations Q2 = $31,271 million
Identify H2 Purchases of property and equipment = $39,643 million
Identify H2 Depreciation of property and equipment = $9,485 million
Identify H2 Stock-based compensation expense = $11,514 million
Identify Q1 Purchases of property and equipment = $17,197 million
Identify Q1 Depreciation of property and equipment = $4,487 million
Identify Q1 Stock-based compensation expense = $5,516 million
EBITDA Q2 computed as Income from operations Q2 + DPE Q2 = 31,271 + 4,998 = $36,269 million
Adjusted EBITDA Q2 computed as 36,269 + 5,998 = $42,267 million
